alert.note: Alert for Rockingham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 10:29PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Rockingham, Henry County, and the City of Martinsville through 1115 PM EDT... At 1028 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sanville to near Spencer to near Prestonville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Martinsville... Stoneville... Spencer... Bassett... Ridgeway... Villa Heights... and Chatmoss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
